history.text: Hi, what is the name of the movie?
hey, it's called The Blind Side, it's an incredible movie about a guy who grew up in poverty but ended up playing for the nfl team, the Ravens.
Steelers Fan here. What's the player's name?
Michael Oher, you're probably familiar with the story as a football fan
Yes.  Sandra Bullock played the mom, right?
Yup and she was incredible in the movie, one of her better performances for sure.
Ok. When did the movie come out?
It came out in 2009. Wow, time flies!
Who played Michael Oher?
A fine actor by the name of Quinton Aaron
What was Sandra Bullock's character's name?
Bullock took on the role of Leigh Anne Tuohy.
Did the movie win any Oscars?
Unfortunately not, there must've been some strong contenders that year.
Do you know how long the movie is?

Nope, it probably had a decent length
.
Which actor plays Mr. Tuohy?
That would be Tim McGraw.
Oh yes.  What position did Michael Oher play?
He was an offensive linemen and I think he was on the left side, since the movie is titled The Blind Side.
You sure know a lot about this movie.  I wish we could discuss other movies as well.
For sure, I would enjoy that.
I guess I have to keep asking questions only about this movie then.  Is it rated PG?
There were some really intense scenes in the movie. I remember one where Michael runs away and then finds his biological mother. It was touching stuff!
Yeah, I think it's pg.
Was his mother in a bad state?
Yeah, she eventually gave him up for adoption because she couldn't take care of him. I think drug use was an issue.
So she was a crack whore?
Not sure what drugs she partook in but she seemed like a nice person when she was sober.
So since it is PG, I guess there are no nude scenes with Sandra Bullock?
There was another great scene that showed Michael running away from the various foster homes he was placed in.
There was definitely no nude scenes lol.
What would really send the audience for a blind side is if there was a nude scene between Michael and Tim McGraw
Are you going to check the movie out? It had a rather impressive A+ CinemaScore!
Yeah I guess, although they were playing older people in the movie.
I think I will.  I saw it back when it came out and was not too impressed because I guess it was so hyped up, but I think it deserves a second viewing because so many people love it so much
I think the movie was more impressive because it was based on a true story.

uid1response.feedback: I already saw the movie, but I always wanted to see it again.  Plus, the other user made the movie sound very good.
